settings.text: Stripes are a firm favourite amongst fashion lovers; there’s no other trend that transcends the years. Whether it’s to accentuate the figure or add a touch of charm - stripes are appropriate for both casual and sophisticated get-ups. Their ability to be equal parts playful and elegant make stripes a wardrobe must-have. Chinti & Parker share their insights on how to flawlessly incorporate stripes into your rotation.

settings.grid-content:
1. Layering

Pairing effortlessly with almost anything, stripes have the ability to tie an outfit together - adding a degree of depth, whilst still being easy on the eye. You may choose to French tuck a striped top or flowy shirt into a midi skirt, using a blazer or leather jacket to drape over your shoulders during cooler months. Irrespective of the season or the occasion, layering is made simple with stripes.

2. Enhance colour

‌Stripes can add a pop of colour to any rendering, perfect for bringing a sense of whimsy. Our Care Bear Collection aims to do just this, featuring styles such as our blue grumpy bear striped wool-cashmere sweater to bring feelings of fun and nostalgia to your day. The delicate pairing of pastel toned baby blue and yellow stripes makes this piece ideal for relaxed spring weekends.

3. Make a statement

When transforming from bland to bold, statement stripes elevate your look in an instant. Rather than blending subtle patterns in with the rest of your ensemble, make your magnificent stripes the sole focus with thick lines and bright, dominant colours, paired with minimalist accessories. Experimentation is key here; whether you choose to wear a striped two-piece, or perhaps you’ve got your eye on a singular, statement garment, the choice is yours to make.

4. Keep it simple

Keep your look subtle with delicate stripes for a dash of intricacy. Our oatmeal multi stripe sleeve sweater is a classic example of our appreciation for smaller details; its neutral tone makes it perfect for pairings, but the colour-block arms subtly enhance the piece through an added degree of warmth. The beauty of stripes is that you don’t need to go overboard to upgrade - often, minimal patterns will do.

5. Accessorising with stripes

When incorporating stripes, toe the line between interesting and overwhelming. Although it is possible to pair stripes with stripes - broken up by vertical and horizontal styles - it’s important to give the eye a break. Accessorising has the ability to make or break an outfit, so by completing bolder striped-looks with a minimal or solid-coloured bag, shoes or jewellery, your look will remain polished.

6. Contrasting patterns

It is possible to pair striped pieces with contrasting patterns, but make sure to choose one colour to dominate, and one to accent - to avoid headaches. From swirls to stars, if the colours blend together seamlessly and you accessorise with minimalistic pieces, the contrasting patterns will all tie together.
